page.title: 14GAMEKEEPERING IN THE BLOCK.
page.content: Keepering in this area is done by three keepers sharing the duties. Red deer are culled; stags from September to 20th October by paying guests, and hinds by the keepers until 15th February. Grouse are shot from 12th August until September on the hills with varying bag sizes eg 15-50 brace. Pheasants here are wild bred and these are shot in the woods and low fields. Roe deer are shot in the woods; the bucks by paying guests in June/July and the does by the keepers in the winter months until February. A few guests are taken fishing on the River Esk which yields salmon,sea and brown trout and a few eels. Vermin eg foxes,stoats,weasles,cats, crows and mink are contolled using traps,snares and by shooting.
